intro: Boopis squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa boopis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its leaves are usually fleshy and covered in a fine, white powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Boopis squarrosa is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
